metadata.title: CVE-2021-3760 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in the Linux kernel. A use-after-free vulnerability in theNFC stack can lead to a threat to confidentiality, integrity, and systemavailability.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-3760` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.4.0-92-generic - 5.4.0-92.103
linux-image-5.4.0-92-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-92.103
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-92-generic - 5.4.0-92.103
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-92-lowlatency - 5.4.0-92.103
No subscription required

linux-image-5.11.0-44-generic - 5.11.0-44.48~20.04.2

criterions.comment: linux package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-92.103').
linux-hwe-5.8: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-hwe-5.11, was needed').
linux-hwe-5.11 package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.11.0-44.48~20.04.2').
